tn.ref: A man of God came out of Judah by the word of Yahweh to Bethel
tn.text: The implied information is that Yahweh sent the man of God to Bethel. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh sent a man of God from Judah to Bethel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is another title for a prophet. AT: "A prophet"
"came from Judah"
Here "word" represents Yahweh's message. AT: "the message of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "He" refers to the man of God.
This means he prophesied toward the altar in a loud and condemning voice. AT: "prophesied loudly toward the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

The prophet spoke to the altar as if it were a person who could hear him. He said this twice for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_apostrophe]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: a son named Josiah will be born to the family of David
tn.text: Here the "family of David" refers to the descendants of David. This can be stated in active form. AT: "a descendant of David will have a son named Josiah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "they" refers to Josiah and the people with him.

tn.ref: the altar will be split apart, and the ashes on it will be poured out
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will split the altar apart and the ashes on it will fall to the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the hand with which he had reached out against the man dried up
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh dried up the hand with which he had reached out against the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"withered" or "became paralyzed" (UDB)

tn.ref: The altar was also split apart
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh also split the altar apart" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: as described by the sign that the man of God had given by the word of Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "as the man of God had described by the word of Yahweh as a sign" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "word" represents Yahweh's message. AT: "the message of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Plead for the favor of Yahweh your God
tn.text: The abstract noun "favor" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "Plead that Yahweh your God may favor me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: my hand may be restored to me again
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh may restore my hand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the king's hand was restored to him again, and it became as it was before
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh restored the king's hand and made it as it was before" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Come home with me and refresh yourself
tn.text: The word "yourself" is a reflexive pronoun. AT: "Come home with me and eat some food" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_rpronouns]])
"half of your house"

tn.ref: You will eat no bread nor drink water, nor return by the way that you came
tn.text: "Do not eat bread, drink water, or return by the way that you came"
"went a different way"

tn.ref: his sons had seen the way
tn.text: The implied information is that the sons also told their father which way the man of God went. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means to place a seat on the back of an animal so a person can ride on it.
This refers to the prophet who lived in Bethel.
"the old prophet said to the man of God"
"The man of God answered"
"go into your house"
"in Bethel"

tn.ref: it was commanded to me by the word of Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh commanded me by his word" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

This is an idiom that means Yahweh spoke. Here "word" represents Yahweh's message. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:06:11|6:11]]. AT: "by the message of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: an angel spoke to me by the word of Yahweh
tn.text: "an angel delivered to me a message from Yahweh"

This is an idiom that means Yahweh spoke. Here "word" represents Yahweh's message. Translate this phrase as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:13:14|13:17]]. AT: "by the message of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: As they sat at the table
tn.text: The implied information is that they were still eating and drinking at the table. AT: "As they were eating and drinking at the table" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This is an idiom that means Yahweh spoke. Here "word" represents Yahweh's message. Translate this phrase as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:13:14|13:17]]. AT: "the message of Yahweh came" or "Yahweh spoke his message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "him" refers to the man of God.

tn.ref: he cried to the man of God
tn.text: "he spoke loudly to the man of God"

tn.ref: Because you have been disobedient to the word of Yahweh
tn.text: "Because you have not obeyed the word of Yahweh"
This means he placed a seat on the back of the donkey so the man of God could ride on it. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:13:11|13:13]].

tn.ref: and his body was left on the road
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and left his body on the road" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"dead body"
Here "it" refers to what they had seen on the road. AT: "they came and told about what they had seen"
"dead body"
"lying in the road"
"lifted up"
"dead body"
Here the word "they" refers to the prophet and his sons.
The word "Woe" here is an expression of great sorrow.
Here the word "he" refers to the old prophet and the word "him" refers to the man of God.

tn.ref: Lay my bones beside his bones
tn.text: Here "my bones" represents his entire body. AT: "Lay my dead body beside his bones" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The implied information is that these were houses of worship. AT: "houses of worship on the high places" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: This matter became sin to the family of Jeroboam
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Jeroboam's family sinned by doing this thing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This phrase refers to Jeroboam's setting up shrines and appointing priests.

tn.ref: caused his family to be destroyed and to be exterminated
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "because of this God destroyed and exterminated Jeroboam's family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: to be destroyed and to be exterminated
tn.text: These mean nearly the same thing. AT: "to be completely destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
